alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 19 at 12:52PM CST until January 21 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Bigbee For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying agricltural land is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday afternoon to a crest of 14.6 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 09/23/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
